schema:name: Condition of Scheduled Monuments in England (based on entries with archaeological assessments), 2019 to 2023

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Condition of Scheduled Monuments in England (based on entries with archaeological assessments)

schema:author.schema:alternateName: Historic Buildings and Monuments Commission for England
schema:author.schema:name: Historic England

notes:
Based on the archaeological assessments of the 19,955 Scheduled Monuments that had been assessed by August 2023. Of these, 19% have been subject to new or updated condition assessments since 2017 and 32% have been assessed since 2013. A further 1% of all features are still to be assessed. As of August 2019, 19,848 Scheduled Monuments had archaeological assessments in place.
    
</br>This indicator is updated biennially; the next scheduled update, using 2025 data, will take place in 2026.

columns.name: year
columns.schema:description: The year range for the data present

datatype.format: Optimal/generally satisfactory|Generally satisfactory but with minor localised problems|Generally satisfactory but with significant localised problems|Generally unsatisfactory with major localised problems|Extensive significant problems|Unknown|Not recorded

columns.name: percentage
columns.schema:description: The percentage of monuments in the corresponding condition
